member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes the message queues, read and write thread

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.Connect(System.String[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Connects to the specified server and port, when the connection fails the next server in the list will be used.
member.param: List of servers to connect to
Portnumber to connect to
member.exception: If there is already an active connection

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.Connect(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Connects to the specified server and port.
member.param: Server address to connect to
Port number to connect to

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.Reconnect
member.summary: Reconnects to the server
member.exception: If there was no active connection
If there is already an active connection

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the server
member.exception: If there was no active connection

member.name: E:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.OnReadLine
member.event: Raised when a \r\n terminated line is read from the socket

member.name: E:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.OnWriteLine
member.event: Raised when a \r\n terminated line is written to the socket

member.name: E:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.OnDisconnecting
member.event: Raised before the connection is closed

member.name: E:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.OnDisconnected
member.event: Raised when the connection is closed

member.name: E:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.OnConnectionError
member.event: Raised when the connection got into an error state

member.name: E:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.OnAutoConnectError
member.event: Raised when the connection got into an error state during auto connect loop

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.IsConnectionError
member.summary: When a connection error is detected this property will return true

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.Address
member.summary: Gets the current address of the connection

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.AddressList
member.summary: Gets the address list of the connection

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.Port
member.summary: Gets the used port of the connection

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.AutoReconnect
member.summary: By default nothing is done when the library looses the connection to the server. Default: false
member.value: true, if the library should reconnect on lost connections false, if the library should not take care of it

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.AutoRetry
member.summary: If the library should retry to connect when the connection fails. Default: false
member.value: true, if the library should retry to connect false, if the library should not retry

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.AutoRetryDelay
member.summary: Delay between retry attempts in Connect() in seconds. Default: 30

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.AutoRetryLimit
member.summary: Maximum number of retries to connect to the server Default: 3

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.AutoRetryAttempt
member.summary: Returns the current amount of reconnect attempts Default: 3

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.SendDelay
member.summary: To prevent flooding the IRC server, it's required to delay each message, given in milliseconds. Default: 200

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.IsRegistered
member.summary: On successful registration on the IRC network, this is set to true.

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.IsConnected
member.summary: On successful connect to the IRC server, this is set to true.

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.VersionNumber
member.summary: Gets the SmartIrc4net version number

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.VersionString
member.summary: Gets the full SmartIrc4net version string

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.Encoding
member.summary:
The encoding to use to write to and read from the socket.
If EnableUTF8Recode is true, reading and writing will always happen using UTF-8; this encoding is only used to decode incoming messages that cannot be successfully decoded using UTF-8.
Default: encoding of the system

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.UseSsl
member.summary: Enables/disables using SSL for the connection Default: false

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.ValidateServerCertificate
member.summary: Specifies if the certificate of the server is validated Default: true

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.SslClientCertificate
member.summary: Specifies the client certificate used for the SSL connection Default: null

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.SocketReceiveTimeout
member.summary: Timeout in seconds for receiving data from the socket Default: 600

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.SocketSendTimeout
member.summary: Timeout in seconds for sending data to the socket Default: 600

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.IdleWorkerInterval
member.summary: Interval in seconds to run the idle worker Default: 60

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.PingInterval
member.summary: Interval in seconds to send a PING Default: 60

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.PingTimeout
member.summary: Timeout in seconds for server response to a PING Default: 600

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.Lag
member.summary: Latency between client and the server

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.ProxyHost
member.summary: If you want to use a Proxy, set the ProxyHost to Host of the Proxy you want to use.

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.ProxyPort
member.summary: If you want to use a Proxy, set the ProxyPort to Port of the Proxy you want to use.

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.ProxyType
member.summary: Standard Setting is to use no Proxy Server, if you Set this to any other value, you have to set the ProxyHost and ProxyPort aswell (and give credentials if needed) Default: ProxyType.None

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.ProxyUsername
member.summary: Username to your Proxy Server

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcConnection.ProxyPassword
member.summary: Password to your Proxy Server

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcCommands.ChangeChannelPrivilege(System.String,System.String,System.String,Meebey.SmartIrc4net.Priority)
member.summary: Give or take a user's privilege in a channel.
member.param: The mode change (e.g. +o) to perform on the user.
The channel in which to perform the privilege change.
The nickname of the user whose privilege is being changed.
The priority with which the mode-setting message should be sent.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcCommands.ChangeChannelPrivilege(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Give or take a user's privilege in a channel.
member.param: The mode change (e.g. +o) to perform on the user.
The channel in which to perform the privilege change.
The nickname of the user whose privilege is being changed.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcCommands.ChangeChannelPrivilege(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Give or take a privilege to/from multiple users in a channel.
member.param: The mode change (e.g. +o) to perform on the users.
The channel in which to give the users a privilege.
The nicknames of the users receiving the privilege.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcCommands.ListChannelMasks(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Fetch a list of entries of a mask-format channel mode.
member.param: The type of the mask-format mode (e.g. +b) to fetch.
The channel whose mode to fetch.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcCommands.ListChannelMasks(System.String,System.String,Meebey.SmartIrc4net.Priority)
member.summary: Fetch a list of entries of a mask-format channel mode.
member.param: The type of the mask-format mode (e.g. +b) to fetch.
The channel whose mode to fetch.
The priority with which the mode-setting message should be sent.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcCommands.ModifyChannelMasks(System.String,System.String,System.String,Meebey.SmartIrc4net.Priority)
member.summary: Add or remove an entry to/from a mask-format channel mode.
member.param: The type of the mask-format mode (e.g. +b) whose entries to modify.
The channel whose mode to edit.
The hostmask of the entry to add/remove.
The priority with which the mode-setting message should be sent.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcCommands.ModifyChannelMasks(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add or remove an entry to/from a mask-format channel mode.
member.param: The type of the mask-format mode (e.g. +b) whose entries to modify.
The channel whose mode to edit.
The hostmask of the entry to add/remove.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcCommands.ModifyChannelMasks(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Add or remove multiple entries to/from a mask-format channel mode.
member.param: The type of the mask-format mode (e.g. +b) whose entries to modify.
The channel whose mode to edit.
The hostmasks of the entries to add/remove.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.Rfc2812.IsValidNickname(System.String)
member.summary:
Checks if the passed nickname is valid according to the RFC
Use with caution, many IRC servers are not conform with this!

member.name: T:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient
member.summary: This layer is an event driven high-level API with all features you could need for IRC programming.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.#ctor
member.summary: This class manages the connection server and provides access to all the objects needed to send and receive messages.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.Connect(System.String[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Connection parameters required to establish an server connection.
member.param: The list of server hostnames.
The TCP port the server listens on.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.Reconnect(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: If the login data should be sent, after successful connect.
If the channels should be rejoined, after successful connect.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.Reconnect(System.Boolean)
member.param: If the login data should be sent, after successful connect.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.Login(System.String[],System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Login parameters required identify with server connection
member.remark: Login is used at the beginning of connection to specify the username, hostname and realname of a new user.
member.param: The users list of 'nick' names which may NOT contain spaces
The users 'real' name which may contain space characters

A numeric mode parameter.
Set to 0 to recieve wallops and be invisible. Set to 4 to be invisible and not receive wallops.
The user's machine logon name
The optional password can and MUST be set before any attempt to register the connection is made.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient._Event_RPL_WELCOME(Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcMessageData)
member.summary: Event handler for welcome reply messages
member.remark: Upon success, the client will receive an RPL_WELCOME (for users) or RPL_YOURESERVICE (for services) message indicating that the connection is now registered and known the to the entire IRC network. The reply message MUST contain the full client identifier upon which it was registered.
member.param: Message data containing reply information

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.ActiveChannelSyncing
member.summary: Enables/disables the active channel sync feature. Default: false

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.PassiveChannelSyncing
member.summary: Enables/disables the passive channel sync feature. Not implemented yet!

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.CtcpVersion
member.summary: Sets the ctcp version that should be replied on ctcp version request.

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.AutoJoinOnInvite
member.summary: Enables/disables auto joining of channels when invited. Default: false

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.AutoRejoin
member.summary: Enables/disables automatic rejoining of channels when a connection to the server is lost. Default: false

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.AutoRejoinOnKick
member.summary: Enables/disables auto rejoining of channels when kicked. Default: false

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.AutoRelogin
member.summary: Enables/disables auto relogin to the server after a reconnect. Default: false

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.AutoNickHandling
member.summary: Enables/disables auto nick handling on nick collisions Default: true

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.SupportNonRfc
member.summary: Enables/disables support for non rfc features. Default: false

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.Realname

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcClient.Username

combined nickname, identity and host of the user that sent the message (nick!ident@host)

channel the message originated from
message

message type

member.summary: User lost owner status (non-RFC, channel mode -q).

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.BounceEventArgs.Server
member.summary: Hostname/address of the server to which the user is being redirected. May be null if not successfully parsed from the message.

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.BounceEventArgs.Port
member.summary: Port of the server to which the user is being redirected. May be -1 if not successfully parsed from the message.

member.name: T:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcUser
member.summary: This class manages the user information.
member.remarks:
only used with channel sync
IrcClient.ActiveChannelSyncing

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcUser.Nick
member.summary: Gets or sets the nickname of the user.
member.remarks: Do _not_ set this value, it will break channel sync!

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcUser.Ident
member.summary: Gets or sets the identity (username) of the user which is used by some IRC networks for authentication.
member.remarks: Do _not_ set this value, it will break channel sync!

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcUser.Host
member.summary: Gets or sets the hostname of the user.
member.remarks: Do _not_ set this value, it will break channel sync!

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcUser.Realname
member.summary: Gets or sets the supposed real name of the user.
member.remarks: Do _not_ set this value, it will break channel sync!

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcUser.IsIrcOp
member.summary: Gets or sets the server operator status of the user
member.remarks: Do _not_ set this value, it will break channel sync!

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcUser.IsRegistered
member.summary: Gets or sets the registered status of the user

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcUser.IsAway
member.summary: Gets or sets away status of the user
member.remarks: Do _not_ set this value, it will break channel sync!

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcUser.Server
member.summary: Gets or sets the server the user is connected to
member.remarks: Do _not_ set this value, it will break channel sync!

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcUser.HopCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the count of hops between you and the user's server
member.remarks: Do _not_ set this value, it will break channel sync!

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcUser.JoinedChannels
member.summary: Gets the list of channels the user has joined

Chat Destination (channels are no valid targets)
Our externally reachable IP Adress (can be anything if passive)

Non DCC Message Priority

member.summary: Access to all DccConnections, Its not possible to change the collection itself, but you can use the public Members of the DccCollections or its inherited Classes.

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcFeatures.CtcpDelegates

member.summary: This Info is shown with the CTCP UserInfo Request

member.summary: This Url will be mentioned with the CTCP Url Request

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.IrcFeatures.CtcpSource
member.summary: The Source of the IRC Program is show in the CTCP Source Request

member.name: T:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties
member.summary: This class stores information about the capabilities and idiosyncrasies of an IRC server. See http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-hardy-irc-isupport-00 for more information.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an empty server properties object.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.HaveNonNullKey(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether the property dictionary contains the given key and it is not null.
member.param: The key to check.
member.returns: Whether the given key maps to a non-null value in the dictionary.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ParseStringNumberPairs(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns a dictionary from parsing a value in the format string:number[,string:number,...]. If the value is unset (i.e. not contained in the dictionary), returns unsetDefault. If the value is empty (i.e. maps to null), returns emptyDefault. defaultValue is used if no number is specified after a colon; if defaultValue is null, this method returns null.

member.name: M:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ParseNumber(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns a numeric value. If the value is unset (i.e. not contained in the dictionary), returns unsetDefault. If the value is empty (i.e. maps to null), returns emptyDefault. On parse failure, returns null. Otherwise, returns the parsed value.

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.RawProperties
member.summary: Contains the properties as returned by the server. If a property has been specified without a value, it is mapped to null.

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.CaseMapping
member.summary: Stores how the server maps between uppercase and lowercase letters. (raw property CASEMAPPING)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ChannelJoinLimits
member.summary: Stores how many channels of a given type a user can join. A return value of null means none were supplied or the value was invalid. The key is a string of channel types which count towards the same total; a value of -1 means an infinite amount. (raw property CHANLIMIT)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ListChannelModes
member.summary: Stores the channel modes which store lists. When a change is sent by the server, it will always contain a parameter; when sent by a client without a parameter, the server will reply with the current list. A return value of null means none or invalid ones were supplied. (raw property CHANMODES, first value)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ParametricChannelModes
member.summary: Stores the channel modes which store a parameter. This parameter must be provided both when adding and when removing the mode. (raw property CHANMODES, second value)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.SetParametricChannelModes
member.summary: Stores the channel modes which store a parameter. This parameter must only be provided when adding the value. (raw property CHANMODES, third value)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ParameterlessChannelModes
member.summary: Stores the channel modes which don't store a parameter. (raw property CHANMODES, fourth value)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ChannelNameLength
member.summary: Stores the maximum length of a channel name. -1 means no limit. (raw property CHANNELLEN)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ChannelTypes
member.summary: Stores the types of channels supported by the server. An empty string means no channels are supported (!). (raw property CHANTYPES)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.SupportsChannelParticipantNotices
member.summary: Stores whether the server supports the CNOTICE command, which allows users with a specific channel privilege to send a notice to another participant in that channel without some of the restrictions that the sever may have placed on NOTICE. (raw property CNOTICE)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.SupportsChannelParticipantPrivMsgs
member.summary: Stores whether the server supports the CPRIVMSG command, which allows users with a specific channel privilege to send a message to another participant in that channel without some of the restrictions that the sever may have placed on PRIVMSG. (raw property CPRIVMSG)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ListExtensions
member.summary: Stores available extensions to the LIST command. (raw property ELIST)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.BanExceptionCharacter
member.summary: Returns what channel mode character is used by the server to signify ban exceptions. null means the server does not support ban exceptions. (raw property EXCEPTS)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.InviteExceptionCharacter
member.summary: Returns what channel mode character is used by the server to signify invite exceptions. null means the server does not support ban exceptions. (raw property INVEX)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.KickMessageLength
member.summary: Returns how long a kick message supplied by the client may be. (raw property KICKLEN)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ListModeLimits
member.summary: Stores how many list channel modes (see ListChannelModes) of a given type a user can set on a channel. (Note that the server may always return more.) A return value of null means none were supplied or the value was invalid. The key is a string of list mode characters which count towards the same total; a value of -1 means an infinite amount. (raw property MAXLIST)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.MaxParametricModeSets
member.summary: Stores how many non-parameterless (list, parametric or set-parametric) modes can be set using a single MODE call. A return value of null means an invalid value has been supplied; a return value of -1 means a theoretically unlimited number of simultaneous mode sets. (raw property MODES)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.NetworkName
member.summary: Stores the display name of the network the IRC server is participating in. A return value of null means the server is not participating in an IRC network. (raw property NETWORK)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.MaxNicknameLength
member.summary: Stores the maximum length of the nickname the client may set. (This has no bearing on the nicknames of other clients.) A return value of null means no or an invalid value was specified. (raw property NICKLEN)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ChannelPrivilegeModesPrefixes
member.summary: Stores the channel privilege modes (e.g. o for op, v for voice) and their corresponding prefixes (e.g. @, +), ordered from most to least powerful. A return value of null means no or an invalid value was specified. (raw property PREFIX)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.ListIsSafe
member.summary: Stores whether using the LIST command is safe, i.e. whether the user won't be disconnected because of the large amount of traffic generated by LIST. (raw property SAFELIST)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.MaxSilenceListEntries
member.summary: Stores the maximum number of entries on a user's silence list. A value of 0 means silence lists are not supported on this server. (raw property SILENCE)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.MaxCommandTargets
member.summary: Maps the commands which support multiple targets to the maximum number of targets each of them supports. A return value of null means the server specified an invalid value. An entry value of -1 means infinity. (raw property TARGMAX)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.MaxTopicLength
member.summary: Stores the maximum topic length that the client may set on a channel on the server. A length of -1 means an infinite length. (raw property TOPICLEN)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.MaxWatchListEntries
member.summary: Stores the maximum number of entries on a user's watch list. A value of 0 means watch lists are not supported on this server. (raw property WATCH)

member.name: P:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ServerProperties.SplitChannelModes
member.summary: Returns the array value of the CHANMODES property, or null if it was invalid.

member.name: T:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.CaseMappingType
member.summary: Represents how lowercase and uppercase are mapped by the server. This information is mostly supplied in the CASEMAPPING server property.

member.name: F:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.CaseMappingType.Unknown
member.summary: The server provided no or an unknown value.

member.name: F:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.CaseMappingType.Ascii
member.summary: The ASCII characters 0x61 to 0x7a (a to z) are defined as the lowercase variants of 0x41 to 0x5a (A to Z). The server provided the string ascii.

member.name: F:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.CaseMappingType.Rfc1459
member.summary: The ASCII characters 0x61 to 0x7e (a to ~) are defined as the lowercase variants of 0x41 to 0x5e (A to ^). The server provided the string rfc1459.

member.name: F:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.CaseMappingType.StrictRfc1459
member.summary: The ASCII characters 0x61 to 0x7d (a to }) are defined as the lowercase variants of 0x41 to 0x5d (A to ]). The server provided the string strict-rfc1459.

member.name: T:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ListExtensions
member.summary: Represents additional functionality available in the LIST command.

member.name: F:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ListExtensions.None
member.summary: No additional functionality is supported by LIST.

member.name: F:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ListExtensions.CreationTime
member.summary: Channel lists may be requested by creation time, using the syntax C>time to search for channels created after the given time and C<time to search for channels created before the given time. (letter: C)

member.name: F:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ListExtensions.ContainsParticipantWithMask
member.summary: Channel lists may be requested by a mask, matching channels in which a user matching the given mask is participating. (letter: M)

member.name: F:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ListExtensions.DoesNotContainParticipantWithMask
member.summary: Channel lists may be requested by a mask, matching channels in which a user matching the given mask is not participating. (letter: N)

member.name: F:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ListExtensions.TopicAge
member.summary: Channel lists may be requested by topic age, using the syntax T>time to search for channels with topics last changed after the given time and T<time to search for channels with topics last changed before the given time. (letter: T)

member.name: F:Meebey.SmartIrc4net.ListExtensions.ParticipantCount
member.summary: Channel lists may be requested by number of participants, using the syntax U>count to search for channels with more than the given number of participants and C<time to search for channels with fewer than the given number of participants. (letter: U)
